duties_responsibilities.duty: Design, configuration, and implementation of Data Center Nexus infrastructure, Branch office Network with QoS Configuration.
Implementation, Configuration, and troubleshooting of Cisco ACI infrastructure.
Routers and Switching infrastructure management & configuration.
Development and performance of a migration plan from traditional data center network designs to Cisco ACI.
Integration of service appliances to Cisco ACI deployments.
Understanding of Inter and Intra Tenant traffic flows, contracts.
Troubleshooting traffic flows, routing, and L3 policies.
Expert in LAN and data center networking (Gigabit Ethernet, L2/L3 Switching, VLANs, STP, VTP etc.).
Network IP address design and optimization.
Configuration and troubleshooting of routing protocols (RIP, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP).
Knowledge in Wireless technology, DNS/DHCP/NTP, and operational support for wireless controllers and APs.
Experience in system platforms like Cisco Nexus, Infoblox, Riverbed, Cisco WLS.
Network optimization solutions like Riverbed, Cisco WAAS.
Experience in SD WAN technologies including Viptela, CloudGenix, Silverpeak, VeloCloud.
Awareness of NSX-T, SDN.
Network Security Operational support on ASA, Juniper firewall.
Wireless network design and Implementation.
Remote system administration.
Automation and reduction of manual efforts through Scripting/tools.
Incident, Change & Problem management.
Capacity Planning.
Vendor Management.
Flexibility to work in a 24 x 7 environment; shift operations.
Supporting escalated tasks/incidents.
Fair Written & Verbal Communication Skills.
Technical Team management of up to 10 resources.
Ownership and Accountability to meet customer SLA / KIP’s.
Proactive approach, anticipate issues and act on them before they become show-stoppers.
Interact with global customers.
Understanding of cultural aspects of people from different geographies.
Experienced in Production Network Environment of a large enterprise impacting 100+ users.
Handling Data Center Network Operations with Business & Mission Critical applications.
Handling escalated incidents or high critical tickets.
Technical Transition & Documentation skills (Onsite to Offshore).
Design, Migration, and up-gradation of existing infrastructure.
Provide input for Weekly and monthly status reports.
Participate in business meetings with various stakeholders on a need basis.
Take corrective actions based on the customer satisfaction surveys.
Work on the service improvement programs.
TakeUP technical training program on multi-vendor SD WAN technologies.
